speaker: TERRANCE PRUIT
line: I always said there's three kinds of people in the world: Them who make things happen, them who watch things happen and them who wonder what happened. I made things happen. The wrong things. I caused pain to anyone who came near me. "Hellbound".)

speaker: TERRANCE PRUIT
line: This tattoo used to be my badge of honor. I'm a different man since I've joined group. A better man. I never thought words like that would come out of my mouth. It's all because of the help and the love that I found in this room.

speaker: DR. HOLLAND
line: You're new here. Is it Ed?

speaker: ED KELSO
line: Yeah, I'm new to this B.S.

speaker: DR. HOLLAND
line: Why do you think it's B.S.?

speaker: TERRANCE PRUIT
line: I mean, listen, man, I turned my life around. A lot of us here have.

speaker: ED KELSO
line: Our kind of lives go one way. You can't change any more than you can undo the crimes you've done.

speaker: TERRANCE PRUIT
line: Well, I feel sorry for you, man.

speaker: ED KELSO
line: Don't feel sorry. You going to hell just like I am, brother.

speaker: DR. HOLLAND
line: Why are you here, Ed?

speaker: ED KELSO
line: I drove Victor. He knows I'm right.

speaker: DR. HOLLAND
line: Victor's been doing good.

speaker: ED KELSO
line: Oh, yeah... just look at him.

speaker: DR. HOLLAND
line: Victor, you want to talk about it?

speaker: VICTOR DALE POTTS
line: I've just been having bad dreams. Really bad dreams.

speaker: DR. HOLLAND
line: What kind of dreams?

speaker: VICTOR DALE POTTS
line: Oh... seeing people skinned alive.

speaker: TERRANCE
line: It's a hard road, Victor. It's a shock to the system: Changing the way we think taking charge of our lives. We're all afraid. And that fear preys on us night and day, brother. In our minds and in our dreams.

speaker: ED KELSO
line: You ever get enough of that crap? "A shock to the system" crap? "This fear preying on us night and day" crap? Those boys in there are afraid Victor?

speaker: VICTOR
line: Sort of.

speaker: ED KELSO
line: What do you mean, "sort of"? Don't tell me that bull does you any good. And don't tell me you feel any better about yourself coming here... that it makes these nightmares go away.

speaker: VICTOR
line: No... it don't.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Hey.

speaker: REYES
line: Hi. Thanks for coming. Sorry about the hour.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: The way you sounded seemed like something that couldn't wait.

speaker: REYES
line: No. I need another set of eyes on it. I called Scully in, too.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: A little late to be looking for a sitter. What's so pressing? "Victor Dale Potts." Ex-con, three-time loser, career criminal.

speaker: REYES
line: He was murdered five days ago. Scully's got the crime report.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I'm sorry, what am I missing?

speaker: REYES
line: It's the way he was killed.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Doggett.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Scully.

speaker: REYES
line: I'd like him to see the body.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Damn. I've seen a bunch of these when I was a cop. It's a favourite of some of the pan-Asian gangs.

speaker: REYES
line: The difference is Victor Potts had a premonition of his death.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: And?

speaker: SCULLY
line: That was my question.

speaker: REYES
line: What I'm saying is, this man was skinned alive just hours after describing it in exact detail.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Maybe he could describe it because maybe somebody threatened him.

speaker: REYES
line: He said it came in a dream, or a vision according to the woman who last spoke to him.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Who's that?

speaker: REYES
line: Dr. Lisa Holland. She's a therapist who runs an anger management group for ex-cons.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Lifelong criminal's bound to have some bad enemies. People capable of this very thing. I mean, unless there's something here that I'm just not seeing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, from what I could see from my visual exam the skin was removed with considerable skill by someone using a hunting-type knife. Arteries and veins were left intact so as to prolong the period that the victim would suffer.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Terrible way to die, for sure.

speaker: REYES
line: I know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is there anything else... Agent Reyes? Something special that brought this case to your attention as a possible X-File?

speaker: REYES
line: No. I just know I need to solve this and I'd appreciate your help.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I'm Doggett. She's Reyes.

speaker: REYES
line: Detective Van Allen?

speaker: VAN ALLEN
line: That's right.

speaker: REYES
line: I appreciate your help on this.

speaker: VAN ALLEN
line: What help is that?

speaker: REYES
line: On this investigation.

speaker: VAN ALLEN
line: There isn't a lot to investigate. I mean, Victor Potts wasn't exactly one of the FBI's ten most wanted.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I think she means your insight into the way he died, Detective.

speaker: VAN ALLEN
line: Don't have any. But I'm sure you'd rather talk to somebody who actually gives a damn, right?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Hate to say it but, he probably sums up most people's feelings.

speaker: DR. HOLLAND
line: It's hard for the Victor Pottses of the world. Nobody cares much about them in life or in death.

speaker: REYES
line: Victor told the group a story about a dream he'd had.

speaker: DR. HOLLAND
line: These men are haunted by their pasts. That's why they're here.

speaker: REYES
line: But this dream came true.

speaker: DR. HOLLAND
line: Sometimes the past they want to escape won't let them. There Victor's case.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You think he could have killed him?

speaker: DR. HOLLAND
line: I try to help these men. Some have been violent, some still are. It's not my place to judge them.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Dr. Holland there's justice to be served here. You can't forget that.

speaker: DR. HOLLAND
line: I'm sure Agent Reyes won't let me. Probably won't let anybody.

speaker: REYES
line: Thank you for your help.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: She contacted you with this case?

speaker: DR. HOLLAND
line: I think the police would have given up on who murdered Victor Potts if it wasn't for her.

speaker: VAN ALLEN
line: You know something, Agent Reyes? You seem real familiar to me.

speaker: REYES
line: Excuse me?

speaker: VAN ALLEN
line: You ever visited Novi before?

speaker: REYES
line: No, I never have.

speaker: ED KELSO
line: You eyeballing me? You got some kind of problem or something?

speaker: TERRANCE PRUIT
line: Problem? Your friend is dead.

speaker: ED KELSO
line: Yeah, I guess the good news is I get to move up the ladder here now.

speaker: TERRANCE PRUIT
line: You know how it happened.

speaker: ED KELSO
line: Now, why don't you just back off.

speaker: TERRANCE PRUIT
line: FBI wants to talk to me now because of the way he died. Going to want to talk to you, too.

speaker: ED KELSO
line: I got nothing to tell nobody.

speaker: TERRANCE PRUIT
line: You were messing with his head.

speaker: ED KELSO
line: I'd watch what you go saying.

speaker: TERRANCE PRUIT
line: Or what? You going to do me, too?

speaker: ED KELSO
line: I got a ride to catch.

speaker: TERRANCE PRUIT
line: Yeah, that's right; walk away. But just like you said you can't run from what you are.

speaker: ED KELSO
line: Yeah, and I'll see you in hell.

speaker: FBI CADET
line: Here you go, Dr. Scully. Everything you ever wanted to know about skinning people but were afraid to ask. This is every case of removal of the human dermis I could find within the last dozen years.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Most of these are post-mortem skinnings.

speaker: FBI CADET
line: That's all I could find. And most of it's Asian gang-related like you mentioned.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Wait a minute. What's this?

speaker: FBI CADET
line: I'm sorry I probably shouldn't have included that one because it's pretty much ancient history.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's just... there's a pattern. There's a pattern... the way the skin's been stripped off. A match?

speaker: FBI CADET
line: No, but how could it be? Did you notice a date?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Excuse me. Dr. Mueller?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Dr. Bertram Mueller?

speaker: DR. MUELLER
line: Yes?

speaker: SCULLY
line: My name is Dana Scully. I'm with the FBI. I want to ask you some questions about a John Doe you did an autopsy on in 1960.

speaker: DR. MUELLER
line: You honestly expect me to recall some case from way back when? I'm 84 years old.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir, this particular victim was skinned alive.

speaker: [CLOSED CAPTION SAYS
line: Will you button your blouse?]

speaker: DR. MUELLER
line: In all my days, I never saw anything as inhuman as this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir, I haven't located police records from the investigation. Was there ever a suspect who was charged or arrested in this case as far as you know?

speaker: DR. MUELLER
line: No suspects, no investigation for that matter.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't understand.

speaker: DR. MUELLER
line: The victim was a John Doe -- a nobody. Carl Hobart, the county sheriff, figured he was a drifter. Hobart said he didn't want to stir up the community.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And no one called him on that?

speaker: DR. MUELLER
line: I tried... the sheriff had other things on his mind, I suppose.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why do you say that?

speaker: DR. MUELLER
line: Well, it wasn't long after that he put a bullet through his head. What are you thinking, doctor? This is some copycat murder 40-odd years later?

speaker: SCULLY
line: If so, it's the most perfectly executed that I've ever seen. And why copy an obscure murder that nobody's ever even heard of?

speaker: DR. MUELLER
line: A string of murders.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm sorry?

speaker: DR. MUELLER
line: I thought you knew. John Doe was only the first.

speaker: TERRANCE PRUIT
line: Is that you, Ed? Come see what I got for you.

speaker: TERRANCE PRUIT
line: Tell you what. You best clear the hell out, whoever you are!

speaker: TERRANCE PRUIT
line: Hey!

speaker: TERRANCE PRUIT
line: Oh, god! Oh, god, no! Let me go! Let me go!

speaker: REYES
line: Dr. Holland? Lisa?

speaker: REYES
line: Dr. Holland?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Monica?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What the hell are you dreaming about.

speaker: REYES
line: Nothing. It was a nightmare. How did you know to come in here?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I was on the phone. I could hear you through the wall calling out.

speaker: REYES
line: Who were you on the phone to?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Dr. Lisa Holland. That anger-management group she runs, it's getting smaller.

speaker: VAN ALLEN
line: It's okay. Let 'em through.

speaker: REYES
line: What happened to the lights?

speaker: VAN ALLEN
line: Somebody cut 'em. Might want to watch your step. We got some blood on the floor. Not as much as you'd expect.

speaker: REYES
line: Oh, my god!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Hey, you okay? Monica?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Reyes, I got a call from Agent Doggett. He said there's another victim. Monica, you okay?

speaker: REYES
line: I'm just catching my breath.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, if you're up for it, I've got something to show you. Case files from crimes back in 1960.

speaker: REYES
line: What are they?

speaker: SCULLY
line: More skinned bodies... cut with the same precision as the body I examined.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Can I see the light a second?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Holy God, he's still alive! Somebody get in here and get him down! We need a medic in here! Can you hear me? Do you understand? Who did this to you? Do you know who did this to you?

speaker: ROXANNE
line: Are we going somewhere, baby?

speaker: ED KELSO
line: You're not. Get out.

speaker: ROXANNE
line: Eddie?

speaker: ED KELSO
line: What'd I just say?!

speaker: ROXANNE
line: But I'm not even dressed.

speaker: ED KELSO
line: What else is new? Get out!

speaker: ROXANNE
line: Why are you such a jerk?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: FBI! Stop right there!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What part of "stop right there" did you not understand?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: So, what? He's just waiting for his lawyer? That's what he's doing?

speaker: DR. HOLLAND
line: He's in a bad place. I've been there myself once or twice sitting right where he is now, not thinking you have a chance.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah? You ever murdered two men?

speaker: DR. HOLLAND
line: He's four years out of prison holding down a job, showing up to work sober. Why do it? Kill a friend and a co-worker?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You're the one that said he was a hothead, right? Why run if you're not guilty? Bag packed to hit the road... packed with knives? him.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What makes you say that?

speaker: REYES
line: Because I think this man here is running from something else. I want to talk to him.

speaker: REYES
line: Hi. My name is Monica. I know what you're thinking, that I must be the good cop.

speaker: ED KELSO
line: No such thing.

speaker: REYES
line: You didn't do it, did you? Your friend, Victor, he said he had bad dreams seeing things. I think you're seeing them now.

speaker: ED KELSO
line: How would you know?

speaker: REYES
line: Maybe I see them, too.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Can I talk to you for a second?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You want to explain to me what you're doing in there Agent Reyes?

speaker: REYES
line: I'm trying to make a connection.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Hell of a way to do it. I can see this guy's defence already. "Your honor, I was having bad dreams... seeing things. Ask Agent Reyes, she's seeing 'em, too." Something you're not telling me?

speaker: VAN ALLEN
line: You two about finished?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: With what?

speaker: VAN ALLEN
line: The suspect. He's not our man.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: VAN ALLEN
line: Girlfriend vouched for him. Said they were getting hammered down

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I know where you live, partner.

speaker: DR. HOLLAND
line: You're always welcome at group.

speaker: REYES
line: Agent Reyes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I need you to come to Quantico right away, Monica.

speaker: [CLOSED CAPTION READS
line: SCULLY: What's your connection to this case, Monica?]

speaker: REYES
line: Why?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I have something to show you.

speaker: REYES
line: Agent Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Reyes.

speaker: REYES
line: What are these?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I showed you files of men killed in 1960 skinned alive like the current victims. Well, I had two of those bodies exhumed looking for crossover forensic details.

speaker: REYES
line: Are there any?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, there are cuts in the bone... on the tibias and on the shoulder girdles that matched the cutting pattern that I found on Victor Potts... using the exact same knife which left a signature pattern of grooves.

speaker: REYES
line: Same knife, same killer that's what you're saying, right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, it's even weirder than that. I ran bios and backgrounds from the victims from 1960.

speaker: REYES
line: They're both ex-convicts like the current victims?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mm-hmm. But look at the date that they died.

speaker: REYES
line: March eighth, 1960. June 21st, 1960. brown.) R-7436 a; VA c54663 n; white; June 21, 1960; Craigsville, VA; 41; 175; med.)

speaker: SCULLY
line: Birth dates of Victor Potts and Terry Pruit. Potts and Pruit were born on the same dates that the previous victims died. You knew that we'd find something like this didn't you, Agent Reyes? How?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: John Doggett.

speaker: REYES
line: Where are you?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Sitting outside the suspect's house wondering where the surveillance is I ordered.

speaker: REYES
line: I need a birthdate on him.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Who?

speaker: REYES
line: The suspect, Ed Kelso. It's important. He may be in danger.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: He may be gone. I'll call you.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah, this is John Doggett. I need to speak with Detective Van Allen. I'll hang on. Just get him.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: No, I'm still holding.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I said this house was supposed to be under a 24-hour watch.

speaker: VAN ALLEN
line: Patrolman says he wasn't gone more than five minutes. to do that to somebody, detective? Only know you said watch him so he don't run.

speaker: REYES
line: Agent Doggett...

speaker: REYES
line: I have something to tell you.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: This thing with the birthdays is weird, no doubt about it. Looks to me like we're dealing with a real sick puppy here.

speaker: REYES
line: I don't think so.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Choosing your victims because of their damn birth dates it's the very definition of a serial killer. I think we should get the boys from behavioural science out on this.

speaker: REYES
line: No. That's not what's happening here.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: It's the only thing that makes sense.

speaker: REYES
line: To you.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Okay, what do you think it is?

speaker: REYES
line: He knew he was going to die. He had a premonition of his death. Just like the first victim did.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: So how do you figure that?

speaker: REYES
line: I'm involved in this some way. I have some kind of memory of it. It's all happened before and now it's happening again.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You mean that it's a copycat and you have some kind of recall.

speaker: REYES
line: These men were born to die this way. The same way they died before.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: The same way they died before?

speaker: REYES
line: Not the men... but their souls. Their souls are murdered over and over again from one lifetime to the next. By someone who won't let them rest.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: So how's this happening... their souls coming back? Reincarnation?

speaker: REYES
line: It doesn't strike you that these men were all born on the dates of the previous victims' deaths?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah, it strikes me. It strikes me that the killer is clever.

speaker: REYES
line: A rag is stuffed in his mouth. A dirty rag. Black with soot.

speaker: REYES
line: Coal dust... from a coal mine.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: How the hell did you know that?

speaker: REYES
line: I don't know.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: So what are we looking for?

speaker: REYES
line: I don't know exactly. But if the old files are correct there's going to be a fourth victim.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: It looks like housekeeping hasn't been here in awhile.

speaker: REYES
line: You or me?

speaker: REYES
line: I'll check out the mine.

speaker: ARTICLE 1
line: "Skinned Body Still Unidentified" .

speaker: ARTICLE 2
line: "Sheriff Carl Hobart Victim of Suicide" photograph shows the Sheriff with a bullet wound in his head.

speaker: ARTICLE 3
line: "Fourth Skinned Body Found - Authorities Without Suspect"

speaker: ARTICLE 4
line: "Lawman Disappears After Failing to Catch Killer" -- "The body of local drifter, *** ***, was found yesterday... ". The accompanying photograph shows a well-dressed man with a derby hat, tie, pin-striped suit and a sheriff's badge on his lapel.

speaker: ARTICLE 5
line: "Prospector Slain in Mining Claim Dispute" "The body of local prospector, *** ***, was found... "

speaker: ARTICLE 6
line: "Murderers Acquitted: Prosecutor Says Justice Not Served" around a skinned body.

speaker: REYES
line: I'm a federal agent. I'm armed. moves closer to her. His face clear in the light cast by the flashlight. It's VAN ALLEN.) You always fail. It's your lot.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Reyes. Monica!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Reyes. Are you hurt? Talk to me.

speaker: REYES
line: He was here.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Who?

speaker: REYES
line: Van Allen. He's who's killing these men.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Van Allen?

speaker: REYES
line: He was skinned himself. Back in 1868 by four men in a mining dispute. His killers were never punished. Now he's born to keep avenging that injustice. Again and again.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Van Allen's the cop here.

speaker: REYES
line: That's why these cases never get solved. Every time, four murders. Every time, four bodies. Then he takes his own life so he can just start it up all over again. There's still a fourth victim, and I think I know who it is. VICTOR DALE POTTS, TERRANCE PRUIT, ED KELSO, and DR. LISA HOLLAND .]

speaker: DR. HOLLAND
line: Lisa Holland.

speaker: REYES
line: Dr. Holland, it's Monica Reyes. You've seen the visions, haven't you? Just like the others in your group. Visions of people skinned alive. It's true, isn't it?

speaker: DR. HOLLAND
line: How did you know?

speaker: REYES
line: Where are you now?

speaker: DR. HOLLAND
line: I'm just finishing a session.

speaker: REYES
line: Is there anybody with you?

speaker: DR. HOLLAND
line: No, they've all left. Why? What's this about?

speaker: REYES
line: Get out of there. You're in danger. It's Detective Van Allen. He's coming after you.

speaker: REYES
line: Dr. Holland? Dr. Holland.

speaker: VAN ALLEN
line: Time's come! You're the last.

speaker: REYES
line: Get the paramedics out here.

speaker: REYES
line: You're not dying on me. Not until you tell me what you mean!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Doc says it's going to be touch-and-go tonight... that we should go home. Go on, Monica. Go on home. There's nothing you're going to learn here now.

speaker: REYES
line: You still won't believe it, will you? My connection to this man.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: However you did it... however you knew what you know what matters here is you saved a woman's life.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's trying. We all are. It's just a long way to go from this...... to this...

speaker: REYES
line: Do you believe in second chances, Dana? A chance to correct the mistakes we make in our lives?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You mean in a future life?

speaker: REYES
line: That's what these people were trying to do. All the victims... trying to atone for their sins from what happened in that photo. Only this man wouldn't let them. mining camp. c. 1868.... " and "... killed in a claim dispute by the men standing over his corpse. No persons... " ]

speaker: SCULLY
line: And Lisa Holland? What about her?

speaker: REYES
line: She was one of them. One of the men you see standing there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And you?

speaker: REYES
line: Whoever I was, I failed. In 1868. In 1909. In 1960, I failed. I was always there, but I couldn't stop the killings. And he knew that. Just like he knows I'm here right now. He feels me -- the way I felt him when I saw that picture of the first victim. And somehow he knows my deepest fear that I'll fail.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, maybe in this life you succeed.

speaker: REYES
line: Maybe.
